alert.note: Alert for Wayne (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 12 at 12:08PM CST until January 17 at 12:00PM CST by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 315 PM CST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of southwest Alabama and southeast Mississippi, including the following counties, in southwest Alabama, Choctaw. In southeast Mississippi, Wayne. * WHEN...Until 315 PM CST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1208 PM CST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Waynesboro, Clara, Silas, Gilbertown, Toxey, Gretna, Isney, Emory, Evansboro, Boice, Contwell, Denham, Aquilla, Melvin, Hiwannee, Woodwards, Water Valley, West King, Paragon and Winchester.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
